modName: Requiem - Ethereal Elven Overhaul compatibility patch
summary: Fixes Requiem 1.8.1 compatibility with Ethereal Elven Overhaul
descriptionHtml:
Ethereal Elven Overhaul has some fairly minor compatibility issues with Requiem. All the textures etc. assets work fine, but the facedata for NPCs and I guess also player presets is overwritten by Requiem so NPCs will use vanilla slider values instead of EEO's sliders. This patch fixes that.

Because the changes would also get overwritten by USKP, Requiem's USKP patch by Azirok (as of writing this it's not available for 1.8.1 from him yet, but you can use something like this: [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/58099/]http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/58099/[/url]) etc., this patch has support for and thus requires those, too. You'll need the Unofficial Skyrim Patch (you should already have this, really), Unofficial Dawnguard Patch (you should also have this already), [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/46067/?]Ethereal Elven Overhaul USKP patches[/url], Requiem, and Azirok's (or someone else's) Requiem USKP support patch.

Load order:
1) Ethereal Elven Overhaul
2) EEO USKP Patch
3) Requiem
4) Requiem USKP Patch
5) Requiem Dragonborn patch if you have it
6) Requiem EEO patch

The Dragonborn support is a little dodgy, but it should work without any real issues with the EEO Dragonborn patch I linked above. The worst that can happen is that the NPCs use vanilla sliders instead of handmade sliders and thus don't look as pretty as they could.

Also, there are some tiny incompatibilities with Cutting Room Floor (you'll either get incorrect sliders for elven NPCs that mod affects, or you won't get CRF changes for those NPCs, depending on which mod you load first) that I didn't fix for this patch, but it's no big deal. They don't have anything to do with Requiem anyway.
author: me
